Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2008 04:22PM momof3nidaho wrote: Shelby, Thanks for your knowledge.  And thanks for your service as a lactation educator.  One came in very helpful with my first child.  I have 3 children and they are all spread basically 2 years apart.  I breastfed all of them.  With my first I was a MILK COW!  And ever since then, I have had what I always thought was colostrum discharging from both nipples.  I stopped breastfeeding my last just a month after he was born (he wouldn't gain weight).  And that was over 2 years ago.  But I still am discharging.  My issue with this never really worried me until a routine exam about a month ago and the doc did the breast exam part and a dark greyish-green discharge came out.  Long story short on this part, had a mammo and u/s and everything was good.   But the doctor wants me to come in for prolactin tests.  I was just reading more online about it and I was surprised to find out that I have several of the symptoms that go along with high levels of prolactin.  Headaches (which I thought were caused by 3 children), really irregular periods, and as much as I hate to admit it, decreased sex drive.  So I suppose I will go take the test and hopefully everything turns out ok. Thanks again Shelby.
Posts.Title: Prolactin question momof3nidaho momof3nidaho

Posts.Content: Dec 5, 2008 06:59PM momof3nidaho wrote: AuntieKayro I'm sorry that you are feeling lonely and scared.  Its OK to feel all of those things.  But I think that you found a really great site to reach out and find some really strong and wonderful women that will give you all of the information that they can.  Don't ever feel like you are alone in this.  There are thousands of women here that have felt the same feelings that you are.  I am so sorry that you are going through this.  You will be in my thoughts and prayers.  Please keep us posted.

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2008 06:06PM momof3nidaho wrote: Tender Thank you for your response and your kind words.  My doc didn't really give me too much to go on, she just wanted me to schedule a mammogram.  And quite honestly, I was in shock that that was even happening.  So I couldn't even think of questions to ask her.  I have had 3 children, and have breastfed all of them.  I have always had some leakage in both breasts that resembled colostrum.  Do you think that is something to be concerned about as well?  The greenish-grey leakage is only in the right breast.
